pullRequest.title: Add test to verify interserver communication
pullRequest.bodyText:
Added test to verify the members of a cluster can see each other.


The clusterview application binds each server instance name in the local JNDI tree for other cluster members to discover through a local JNDI lookup.


The sample application uses a Servlet to bind and unbind in the lifecycle methods.


Also fixed the build application to use only the persistent volume for all build scripts and application source.


Fixed Cleanup util to delete pv and pvc created by the build application util.


https://build.weblogick8s.org:8443/job/weblogic-kubernetes-operator-kind-new/323/

commit.message: Fix the build application to copy application folder recursively
Add checks for pv and pvc delete
Build the application in a separate directory so that pv can be cleaned up
Create secret only if it doesn't exist
Create unique names for all artifacts
Fix persistent volume claim  deletion when there is no label
Add new check for bound status
change the reclaim policy to recycle
Fix the clusterview app to bind and unbind in lifecycle methods

nodes.bodyText: Another possible reason is that the response contained unexpected content (did not contain ServerName/Bound).  It'd be helpful to accumulate an 'error' string that contains 'unexpected' responses (e.g. does not contain at least ServerName of one of the servers), and dump the String here on a failure.

I'm not sure about this, but if you were to view this output in a browser, I suspect the newlines would be ignored and it'd all end up munged into one line. If so, you can put a 
 after  and a
before to correct this. Ditto for the JSPs.

commit.message: Address review comments from Tom B
Change ti NamingException instead of namenotfoundexception
